abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Enterprise Reform
            Technical Assistance Loan Project for Ecuador were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; sustainability was
            likely; institutional development impact was substantial;
            the Bank performance was satisfactory; and the Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: in a changing political environment especially in
            a situation of economic and political turmoil and absence of
            political protection for reforms, the objective of technical
            assistance was appropriately limited to facilitating the
            reform of sector structures and the strengthening of the new
            structures needed to enhance private participation. The
            envisioned sector privatization requires a permanent
            commitment by the Government to reform that extends beyond
            the scope and duration of the project supporting the
            technical assistance. Well-articulated public information
            and communications campaigns are a key to successful sector
            reforms. These campaigns need to be directed at decision
            makers as well as stakeholders such as management and
            employees of state enterprises. Continued consultations need
            to be maintained with sector entities, groups directly
            affected by actions to be supported by technical assistance,
            professional groups, and other shareholders so as to gain
            their support in the reform process.
